commit_list.message:
httpdomain: Fix performance bottleneck in doctree lookup.

We have started experiencing longer and longer processing times in the
write-phase which we tracked down to the httpdomain extension and
specifically the `env.get_doctree` lookup within the `resolve_xref`
method.

The doctree lookup is performed excessively for the same
value but each call results in a load from disk and unpickling which
quickly starts adding up to the processing time. See below for a
profiling results excerpt for a local run where the unpickling clearly
dominates.

```
*** PROFILER RESULTS ***
resolve_xref (/XXX/eggs/sphinxcontrib_httpdomain-1.4.0-py3.5.egg/sphinxcontrib/httpdomain.py:643)
function called 5892 times

         22212200 function calls in 258.476 seconds

   Ordered by: cumulative time, internal time, call count
   List reduced from 58 to 40 due to restriction <40>

   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
     5892    0.078    0.000  258.475    0.044 httpdomain.py:643(resolve_xref)
     4705    0.131    0.000  258.093    0.055 environment.py:1220(get_doctree)
     4705  238.529    0.051  257.270    0.055 {built-in method _pickle.load}
  7302272    4.311    0.000   18.752    0.000 nodes.py:336(__new__)
  7302272   12.874    0.000   12.874    0.000 {built-in method __new__ of type object at 0x10f13dee0}
  7364193    1.583    0.000    1.583    0.000 {built-in method builtins.isinstance}
```

This commit adds a module level cache for looking up the doctrees. As
the httpdomain does not currently declare support for parallel mode
during the read-phase there is  no specific concurrency protection in
place for the cache.

commit_list.message: Added a read-only Repo.active_branch property which returns the name of the currently active branch.
Cosmetic fixes to be consistent with the overall coding style.

Added a read-only property Repo.is_dirty which reflects the status of the
working directory.

A working directory is dirty if it has any uncommitted changes (in the working
directory or in the index). Bare repositories are by nature always clean.

Create filenames in ascending sort order

Using the hyphen "-" as the separator for filenames with collision has
makes these filenames sort earlier than the original file. It is
useful to be able to sort the generated files by their name and assume
that the last filename in the sorted list represents the latest sent
email.

Using an underscore solves this issue since it sorts later than a
period, e.g.

  >>> sorted(['2013-07-22-131955.eml', '2013-07-22-131955_1.eml', '2013-07-22-131955-1.eml'])
  ['2013-07-22-131955-1.eml', '2013-07-22-131955.eml', '2013-07-22-131955_1.eml']

Fix CSS images for sites using virtual host _vh_ components.

Using absolute paths for images in CSS breaks when a site is not served from
the root of the domain. We should rather use relative URLs (without the
leading slash) and have the CSS registry replace them with absolute paths
dynamically.

commit_list.message: Release 1.0b1
PEP8 cleanup.

Don't break if a feed does not have an "rel=alternate type=html" link.

It is possible for a valid Atom feed to omit a

  <link rel="alternate" type="html" href="http://server.com"/>

element which is available through the feedparser object as a

  feed.link

attribute. If the feed does not have this element then the RSS portlet
will throw an AttributeError which will propagate to the page preventing
the original page from rendering.

This changeset adds support for such feeds.

commit_list.message:
Fixed purge paths for virtual hosting scenarios using virtual path components.

In case the virtual host setup includes virtual path components which are not
part of the ZODB path hierarchy, the generated purge paths are incorrect.

For example, assuming the following rewrite rule in Apache

  RewriteRule ^/a/b/?(.*)/?$ http://127.0.0.1:5128/VirtualHostBase/http/%{SERVER_NAME}:80/VirtualHostRoot/_vh_a/_vh_b/$1 [P,L]

which contains a two-part virtual path ``/a/b`` results in the following kind of
of URL to be sent to Varnish

  /VirtualHostBase/http/server.com:80/VirtualHostRoot/_vh_a/_vh_b/plone/my-document

however, when the purge URLs are generated using the ``absolute_url_path``
method they look like

  /VirtualHostBase/http/server.com:80/VirtualHostRoot/_vh_a/_vh_b/a/b/plone/my-document

containing the virtual "/a/b" part which does not match with what gets cached in
Varnish.

Instead of using ``absolute_url_path`` the ``virtual_url_path`` method should be
used instead to avoid the virtual parts.

Note that ``virtual_url_path`` does not have a leading slash which needs to be
added explicitly.

commit_list.message:
Clear the index data structures before (re)indexing an object.

Previously it was possible for the index to contain stale data from a previous
indexing of an object which caused false results in queries.

This was particularly a problem when an object was first indexed with recurrence
information and then reindex with recurrence removed. Subsequent queries would
still return hits from the previous recurrence period.

commit_list.message:
Fixed a bug when the ids_to_launch parameter is empty.

This broke the initialization of ckeditor instances as part of the
onload handler.

Changed the way external plugins are registered in javascript.

It's better to use the three parameter variant of
``CKEDITOR.plugins.addExternal`` because this will make the base URL
for the plugin resources available within the plugin code as
``this.path`` correctly.

Otherwise ``this.path`` contains the full URL to the plugin script
itself which consequently breaks loading of related resources
(images, translations, etc).

Before, this.path was something like

  http://server.com/++resource++my.package/ckeditor/plugin.js?t=xxxx

and now it gets correctly set to

  http://server.com/++resource++my.package/ckeditor/
Refactored the ck_ruid_to_url transform to use plone.app.uuid

Fixed the finder to honor the 'Allow folder creation' configuration option.

commit_list.message:
Fixed a bug with the datepicker configuration when week does not start on Sunday.

The jQuery Tools datepicker needs to always be given the list of week day
names starting from Sunday and passed the 'firstDay' option to control
the first day of week (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ...).
Added a wrapper element around the time components in the z3c.form datetime widget markup
Fixed a bug where the minutes were ignored when extracting the field values.

Fixed a problem with zero valued time components.

Zero valued time components were ignored as empty values due to direct
comparison in boolean context. As a result when editing a field with a valid
time component (for example midnight) the form field did not get populated
correctly.

Fixed a problem with timezone aware UNTIL values in recurrence rules.

If the recurrence rule contains an ending date (UNTIL) which is timezone aware
this will be parsed by dateutil.rrule.rrulestr() into a timezone aware
datetime instance.

The `recurrence_sequence_ical` deals with timezone-naive instances be design
resulting in a comparison of timezone-aware and timezone-naive datetime
instance which throws the following exception:

  TypeError: can't compare offset-naive and offset-aware datetimes

commit_list.message:
Fixed an issue with passing an interpolation mapping in translator.

Previously it was possible to provide an interpolation mapping only as part of
a translation string. Providing it later during translation would be ignored.

This change allows you to provide the mapping as part of the translator call,
e.g.

  translator(tstring, mapping={...})

if the tstring does not contain a mapping itself, the mapping given in the
translator() call will be used as is. Otherwise, the previously given mapping
will be updated with the new values allowing partial overriding of an existing
mapping.

we can pretty print the JSON and the commands look cleaner.

commit_list.message:
Use snapshots and parametrized tests for builders

This significantly cuts down the effort required to add and maintain the test
for the command builders. Previously adding new tests, and especially
refactoring existing ones, after the builders changed required a lot of
manual, mechanical work.

Using snapshot testing removes the need to manually manage the result
fixtures. New snapshots will be created automatically and existing ones
can be updated using the `--snapshot-update` switch to pytest.

Additionally, using parametrized tests with `@pytest.mark.parametrize`
makes it easy to add new tests with minimal effort.

Also, tox now passes on command line arguments to pytest allowing the
tests to be run with

    tox --develop -- --snapshot-update

commit_list.message:
Switched the order of i18n:attributes values with explicit message ids.

Previously, it was expected that when providing both the attribute name and
the messsage id the first value be the message id and the second one the name
of the attribute.

However, at least the Chameleon implementation of ZPT implements this order
differently (and IIRC the zope.pagetemplate does the same) requiring the
first item to be the name of the attribute and the second (optional) one
the message id.

See http://pagetemplates.org/docs/latest/reference.html#i18n-attributes
for details.
commit_list.repo_description: Use xls files to update translations

commit_list.message:
Expose conflicting data in case of LWTException

Adds a custom attribute, `existing`, to the LWTException instance which
allows the application layer to inspect the values read from Cassandra
which conflicted with the attempted conditional write.

The documentation already referred to the `existing` attribute but it
was not implemented.

Fix logic determining if compaction options need syncing

The compaction_strategy_options as received from the
`system.schema_columnfamilies` table are all string valued and
comparison to typed values (ints, floats) as defined in models results
in sync_table() issuning ALTER TABLE statements redundantly even if
there were no changes to compaction options.

This patch casts the values defined in models to strings to ensure they
compare equal as needed.

Additionally, this patch normalizes handling of the `min_threshold` and
`max_threshold` options for SizeTieredCompactionStrategy which exist
outside the `compaction_strategy_options` mapping and have different
names in the `system.schema_columnfamilies` table compared to the CQL
options.

A typo in the `BaseModel.__compaction_tombstone_threshold__` option is
also fixed.
Make get_table_settings use CL.ONE explicitly

Use CL.ONE explicitly when interacting with the system keyspace

The system keyspace uses  "LocalStrategy" for replication so it needs to
be accessed with CL.ONE. If the default consistency level is set to
something else all management commands which rely on introspecting the
system keyspace will fail.
Test demonstrating regression in querying with dates

commit_list.message:
Refactored the tests into unit tests and integration tests.

It is not sensible to modify the CA registrations in integration tests because
this breaks the assumptions made by plone(.app).testing layer setup. The idea
in plone(.app).testing is to set up the CA in particular manner for a layer
which is a shared state between all tests within the layer. Modifying the CA
registrations within a single test breaks this contract.

We can also see that the raptus article registrations are not in the global
registry nor the local registry by inspecting

    zope.component.globalSiteManager._adapter_registrations

nor are they in the Plone local site manager

    self.portal.getSiteManager()._adapter_registrations

which is why the self.portal.getSiteManager().unregisterAdapter() call failed.
They are registered in a custom site manager set up by plone.app.testing which
can be seen by inspecting

    self.portal.getSiteManager().__bases__[0]._adapter_registrations

Calling

    self.portal.getSiteManager().__bases__[0].unregisterAdapter(...)

would unregister the adapter as was the original attempt but this
unregistering would leak to all tests in the same layer that run after the
call to unregisterAdapter() therefore breaking the layer contract.

In these cases I find the better to test the edge cases of the functions in
unit tests and mock the CA since we want to test the functionality itself, not
the Zope CA. We can then use integration tests for positive assertations.

For mocking, the mock package has proven very useful in testing. See

    http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/

for details.

commit_list.message:
Do not attempt to parse the SReg dob field into a DateTime.

The SReg specification allows the user to reveal only parts of the
dob by specifying parst of the YYYY-MM-DD string as zeroes, e.g.
1979-00-00 to only reveal the birth year. DateTime parsing
fails in this case.

It is better to store the value as a string and let the application
layer to handle it.

commit_list.message: Release 1.3.6.
Fixed the collective.quickupload styling.
Added Finnish translations.
Initialized Finnish translations.

Fix logic determining if compaction options need syncing

The compaction_strategy_options as received from the
`system.schema_columnfamilies` table are all string valued and
comparison to typed values (ints, floats) as defined in models results
in sync_table() issuning ALTER TABLE statements redundantly even if
there were no changes to compaction options.

This patch casts the values defined in models to strings to ensure they
compare equal as needed.

Additionally, this patch normalizes handling of the `min_threshold` and
`max_threshold` options for SizeTieredCompactionStrategy which exist
outside the `compaction_strategy_options` mapping and have different
names in the `system.schema_columnfamilies` table compared to the CQL
options.

A typo in the `BaseModel.__compaction_tombstone_threshold__` option is
also fixed.

commit_list.message:
Use CL.ONE explicitly when interacting with the system keyspace

The system keyspace uses  "LocalStrategy" for replication so it needs to
be accessed with CL.ONE. If the default consistency level is set to
something else all management commands which rely on introspecting the
system keyspace will fail.

commit_list.message:
Pass the augmented environment to the hook scripts.

The call signature for the hook scripts was changed by adding a third
parameter which is a dictionary containing the environment variables copied
from ``os.environ`` and augmented with the environment overrides from the
part configuration.

Existing hook scripts that accept only two arguments continue to work but
reading ``os.environ`` directly will not contain the overridden values.
commit_list.repo_description: zc.buildout recipe for compiling and installing source distributions

commit_list.message:
Refactored the environment variable handling logic.

Python versions prior to 2.6 have an issue clearing the environment variables
using ``os.environ.clear()`` (See http://bugs.python.org/issue3227).

Instead of modifying ``os.environ`` directly we use the ``subprocess``
module to run the commands in child processes which are given an explicit
environment which is a copy of the current ``os.environ`` augmented with
the per-part overrides.

See https://github.com/hexagonit/hexagonit.recipe.cmmi/issues/issue/1/#issue/1/comment/605362
for details.

Due to this change the hook scripts no longer have the augmented environment.
They can still access the buildout configuration to read the overrides but
need to do this manually.

Merge pull request #2 from radekj/patch-1

I'm merging this since it is a rather trivial change.

commit_list.message:
httpdomain: Fix performance bottleneck in doctree lookup.

We have started experiencing longer and longer processing times in the
write-phase which we tracked down to the httpdomain extension and
specifically the `env.get_doctree` lookup within the `resolve_xref`
method.

The doctree lookup is performed excessively for the same
value but each call results in a load from disk and unpickling which
quickly starts adding up to the processing time. See below for a
profiling results excerpt for a local run where the unpickling clearly
dominates.

```
*** PROFILER RESULTS ***
resolve_xref (/XXX/eggs/sphinxcontrib_httpdomain-1.4.0-py3.5.egg/sphinxcontrib/httpdomain.py:643)
function called 5892 times

         22212200 function calls in 258.476 seconds

   Ordered by: cumulative time, internal time, call count
   List reduced from 58 to 40 due to restriction <40>

   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
     5892    0.078    0.000  258.475    0.044 httpdomain.py:643(resolve_xref)
     4705    0.131    0.000  258.093    0.055 environment.py:1220(get_doctree)
     4705  238.529    0.051  257.270    0.055 {built-in method _pickle.load}
  7302272    4.311    0.000   18.752    0.000 nodes.py:336(__new__)
  7302272   12.874    0.000   12.874    0.000 {built-in method __new__ of type object at 0x10f13dee0}
  7364193    1.583    0.000    1.583    0.000 {built-in method builtins.isinstance}
```

This commit adds a module level cache for looking up the doctrees. As
the httpdomain does not currently declare support for parallel mode
during the read-phase there is  no specific concurrency protection in
place for the cache.

commit_list.message:
httpdomain: Fix performance bottleneck in doctree lookup.

We have started experiencing longer and longer processing times in the
write-phase which we tracked down to the httpdomain extension and
specifically the `env.get_doctree` lookup within the `resolve_xref`
method.

The doctree lookup is performed excessively for the same
value but each call results in a load from disk and unpickling which
quickly starts adding up to the processing time. See below for a
profiling results excerpt for a local run where the unpickling clearly
dominates.

```
*** PROFILER RESULTS ***
resolve_xref (/XXX/eggs/sphinxcontrib_httpdomain-1.4.0-py3.5.egg/sphinxcontrib/httpdomain.py:643)
function called 5892 times

         22212200 function calls in 258.476 seconds

   Ordered by: cumulative time, internal time, call count
   List reduced from 58 to 40 due to restriction <40>

   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
     5892    0.078    0.000  258.475    0.044 httpdomain.py:643(resolve_xref)
     4705    0.131    0.000  258.093    0.055 environment.py:1220(get_doctree)
     4705  238.529    0.051  257.270    0.055 {built-in method _pickle.load}
  7302272    4.311    0.000   18.752    0.000 nodes.py:336(__new__)
  7302272   12.874    0.000   12.874    0.000 {built-in method __new__ of type object at 0x10f13dee0}
  7364193    1.583    0.000    1.583    0.000 {built-in method builtins.isinstance}
```

This commit adds a module level cache for looking up the doctrees. As
the httpdomain does not currently declare support for parallel mode
during the read-phase there is  no specific concurrency protection in
place for the cache.

commit_list.message:
Fixed a bug with the datepicker configuration when week does not start on Sunday.

The jQuery Tools datepicker needs to always be given the list of week day
names starting from Sunday and passed the 'firstDay' option to control
the first day of week (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ...).
Added a wrapper element around the time components in the z3c.form datetime widget markup
Fixed a bug where the minutes were ignored when extracting the field values.

Fixed a problem with zero valued time components.

Zero valued time components were ignored as empty values due to direct
comparison in boolean context. As a result when editing a field with a valid
time component (for example midnight) the form field did not get populated
correctly.

Maintain information about the wrapped function in @indexer

Now the @indexer decorated function has the __doc__, __module__, __name__, etc information from the original wrapped function.

This is particularly useful when generating documentation for code
using something like Sphinx's autodoc extension. Previously all the
@indexer decorated functions had the (same) documentation of the DelegatingIndexerFactory class instead of the wrapped functions making the autogenerated documentation rather pointless.
commit_list.repo_description: provides primitives to help delegate ZCatalog indexing operations to adapters

commit_list.message: Merge branch 'plone-4.2'

Use MailHost.send() instead of SecureMailHost.secureSend().

SecureMailHost has been deprecated but Plone still offers a monkey-patched secureSend method for backwards compatibility. However, this
method sends the email immediately without the transaction support
provided by zope.sendmail resulting in multiple messages sent in case the transaction gets retried multiple times.

Disabled the TineMCE.getContentType monkey patch.

Plone 4.1.6/TinyMCE 1.2.12 has a different implementation of the
TineMCE.getContentType method which is not compatible with the monkey patch.

For now I'm simply disabling the monkey patch since it's breaking edits. Should
a newer version of the monkey patch be still needed it can be revisited later.

Merge pull request #1 from aleksandr-rakov/master

Agreed, the function should only close file handles it explicitly opens. Good catch.

commit_list.message:
Switched the order of i18n:attributes values with explicit message ids.

Previously, it was expected that when providing both the attribute name and
the messsage id the first value be the message id and the second one the name
of the attribute.

However, at least the Chameleon implementation of ZPT implements this order
differently (and IIRC the zope.pagetemplate does the same) requiring the
first item to be the name of the attribute and the second (optional) one
the message id.

See http://pagetemplates.org/docs/latest/reference.html#i18n-attributes
for details.

commit_list.message:
Fix logic determining if compaction options need syncing

The compaction_strategy_options as received from the
`system.schema_columnfamilies` table are all string valued and
comparison to typed values (ints, floats) as defined in models results
in sync_table() issuning ALTER TABLE statements redundantly even if
there were no changes to compaction options.

This patch casts the values defined in models to strings to ensure they
compare equal as needed.

Additionally, this patch normalizes handling of the `min_threshold` and
`max_threshold` options for SizeTieredCompactionStrategy which exist
outside the `compaction_strategy_options` mapping and have different
names in the `system.schema_columnfamilies` table compared to the CQL
options.

A typo in the `BaseModel.__compaction_tombstone_threshold__` option is
also fixed.

commit_list.message:
Use CL.ONE explicitly when interacting with the system keyspace

The system keyspace uses  "LocalStrategy" for replication so it needs to
be accessed with CL.ONE. If the default consistency level is set to
something else all management commands which rely on introspecting the
system keyspace will fail.

commit_list.message:
Fixed a bug in Message.toPostArgs() related to UTF-8 encoded values.

In generating the argument dictionary the .toPostArgs() method (apparently)
assumed that values were all Unicode objects and called
``value.encode('utf-8')`` on them unconditionally. However, the values appear
to be a mixed set of Unicode objects and UTF-8 encoded strings (most being of
the latter group).

Calling .encode('utf-8') on a string will implicitly decode the string into a
Unicode object before encoding it to the selected encoding. This automatic
decoding happens using the ``sys.getdefaultencoding()`` encoding which is by
default 'ascii'. The original call therefore works only as long as the values
are 7-bit ASCII and breaks when they contain higher bit characters.

The patch ensures that the resulting values in the returned dictionary are
UTF-8 encoded strings regardless if the input values were Unicode objects or
UTF-8 strings.
commit_list.repo_description: OpenID library for Python

commit_list.message:
Fixed a bug in Message.toFormMarkup() related to encoding UTF-8 encoded form values.

The .toFormMarkup() method that generates a <form> HTML structure had a bug
when the form field values contained UTF-8 encoded strings with characters
outside the 7-bit ASCII space.

If the lxml implementation of the ElementTree API was in use these values
would result in a ValueError being raised (ValueError: All strings must be XML
compatible: Unicode or ASCII, no NULL bytes or control characters). If the
stdlib implementation of ElementTree was used these characters were silently
replaced by their XML character reference equivalents (&#XXX;).

This patch generates the form using Unicode values for everything and then
serializes the form to a UTF-8 encoded string ensuring that the final form is
what is expected and constant regardless of the ElementTree API
implementation.
commit_list.repo_description: OpenID library for Python

commit_list.message:
Expose conflicting data in case of LWTException

Adds a custom attribute, `existing`, to the LWTException instance which
allows the application layer to inspect the values read from Cassandra
which conflicted with the attempted conditional write.

The documentation already referred to the `existing` attribute but it
was not implemented.
commit_list.repo_description: Debian package build scripts for python-cassandra-driver project

commit_list.message:
Fix logic determining if compaction options need syncing

The compaction_strategy_options as received from the
`system.schema_columnfamilies` table are all string valued and
comparison to typed values (ints, floats) as defined in models results
in sync_table() issuning ALTER TABLE statements redundantly even if
there were no changes to compaction options.

This patch casts the values defined in models to strings to ensure they
compare equal as needed.

Additionally, this patch normalizes handling of the `min_threshold` and
`max_threshold` options for SizeTieredCompactionStrategy which exist
outside the `compaction_strategy_options` mapping and have different
names in the `system.schema_columnfamilies` table compared to the CQL
options.

A typo in the `BaseModel.__compaction_tombstone_threshold__` option is
also fixed.

commit_list.message:
Use CL.ONE explicitly when interacting with the system keyspace

The system keyspace uses  "LocalStrategy" for replication so it needs to
be accessed with CL.ONE. If the default consistency level is set to
something else all management commands which rely on introspecting the
system keyspace will fail.

commit_list.message:
Log the CQL statements at DEBUG level.

This logs the CQL statements emitted by cqlengine in the
`cqlengine.cql` logger at DEBUG level. For debugging purposes you can
enable that logger to help work out problems with your queries.

The logger is not enabled by default by `cqlengine`.

commit_list.message:
Allow `datetime.date` values with `columns.DateTime`.

Adds support for setting a `datetime.date` value to a `DateTime`
column. The value will be transparently converted to a
`datetime.datetime` with the time components set to zero.

Ensure response headers are given as strings (not unicode)

The dictionary containing the headers has both keys and values given as
unicode which caused a problem when running with waitress 0.8.9. This
commit ensures the headers are encoded to UTF-8.

commit_list.message:
Fixed a compatibility issue with IE8 and below.

The ``Array.indexOf`` is only available in IE9 and up. It's better to
use the jQuery.inArray method which uses Array.indexOf internally if
it is available but works also in older browsers.

Cosmetic fixes to be consistent with the overall coding style.

Added a read-only property Repo.is_dirty which reflects the status of the
working directory.

A working directory is dirty if it has any uncommitted changes (in the working
directory or in the index). Bare repositories are by nature always clean.

commit_list.message:
httpdomain: Fix performance bottleneck in doctree lookup.

We have started experiencing longer and longer processing times in the
write-phase which we tracked down to the httpdomain extension and
specifically the `env.get_doctree` lookup within the `resolve_xref`
method.

The doctree lookup is performed excessively for the same
value but each call results in a load from disk and unpickling which
quickly starts adding up to the processing time. See below for a
profiling results excerpt for a local run where the unpickling clearly
dominates.

```
*** PROFILER RESULTS ***
resolve_xref (/XXX/eggs/sphinxcontrib_httpdomain-1.4.0-py3.5.egg/sphinxcontrib/httpdomain.py:643)
function called 5892 times

         22212200 function calls in 258.476 seconds

   Ordered by: cumulative time, internal time, call count
   List reduced from 58 to 40 due to restriction <40>

   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
     5892    0.078    0.000  258.475    0.044 httpdomain.py:643(resolve_xref)
     4705    0.131    0.000  258.093    0.055 environment.py:1220(get_doctree)
     4705  238.529    0.051  257.270    0.055 {built-in method _pickle.load}
  7302272    4.311    0.000   18.752    0.000 nodes.py:336(__new__)
  7302272   12.874    0.000   12.874    0.000 {built-in method __new__ of type object at 0x10f13dee0}
  7364193    1.583    0.000    1.583    0.000 {built-in method builtins.isinstance}
```

This commit adds a module level cache for looking up the doctrees. As
the httpdomain does not currently declare support for parallel mode
during the read-phase there is  no specific concurrency protection in
place for the cache.

httpdomain: Fix performance bottleneck in doctree lookup.

We have started experiencing longer and longer processing times in the
write-phase which we tracked down to the httpdomain extension and
specifically the `env.get_doctree` lookup within the `resolve_xref`
method.

The doctree lookup is performed excessively for the same
value but each call results in a load from disk and unpickling which
quickly starts adding up to the processing time. See below for a
profiling results excerpt for a local run where the unpickling clearly
dominates.

```
*** PROFILER RESULTS ***
resolve_xref (/XXX/eggs/sphinxcontrib_httpdomain-1.4.0-py3.5.egg/sphinxcontrib/httpdomain.py:643)
function called 5892 times

         22212200 function calls in 258.476 seconds

   Ordered by: cumulative time, internal time, call count
   List reduced from 58 to 40 due to restriction <40>

   ncalls  tottime  percall  cumtime  percall filename:lineno(function)
     5892    0.078    0.000  258.475    0.044 httpdomain.py:643(resolve_xref)
     4705    0.131    0.000  258.093    0.055 environment.py:1220(get_doctree)
     4705  238.529    0.051  257.270    0.055 {built-in method _pickle.load}
  7302272    4.311    0.000   18.752    0.000 nodes.py:336(__new__)
  7302272   12.874    0.000   12.874    0.000 {built-in method __new__ of type object at 0x10f13dee0}
  7364193    1.583    0.000    1.583    0.000 {built-in method builtins.isinstance}
```

This commit adds a module level cache for looking up the doctrees. As
the httpdomain does not currently declare support for parallel mode
during the read-phase there is  no specific concurrency protection in
place for the cache.
